Cutting York Sport membership is welcome but overdue

If every cloud has a silver lining then news coming from York Sport this week is a shiny sliver around the huge, black weather system that is the tuition fees increase (Thumbnail credit Radical changes could be coming to the Sports Centre under new plans. Image: Peter Iveson)

Men's lacrosse draw in frenetic encounter with Yorkshire rivals

The men's lacrosse team battled to a draw that looked improbable at some points during their BUCS clash with local rivals Leeds this Wednesday (Thumbnail credit The White Rose look to win back possesion on the 22 acres Image: Peter Iveson)

Women's footballers halt high-flying Newcastle to claim first win

York's women's footballers claimed their first victory of the season with a hard-fought win over Newcastle University firsts (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Depleted football seconds comfortably defeated by Leeds

York's seconds football team fell to a 3-0 defeat against high-flying Leeds thirds on Wednesday, in a match marred by controversy (Thumbnail credit Sam Clitheroe fends off a Leeds cross. Image: Peter Iveson)

Scottish football needs to look South

Christopher Underwood argues that, in order to progress, Scottish football needs to look South (Thumbnail credit Kris Boyd left Rangers to join Middlesbrough in the summer. Image: superleague formula: thebeautifulrace via Flickr Creative Commons)

Late comeback not enough for men's hockey team

York succumbed to a series of offensive onslaughts against local and league rivals Leeds this Wednesday afternoon (Thumbnail credit Image: Phillipa Grafton)

Badminton firsts end season with thrilling win

The men's badminton firsts had to win on Sunday afternoon to secure their place in the Northern Conference 1A league and win they did, defeating the University of Liverpool 5-3 thanks mainly to captain James Davies (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

2011 - The Year of Andy Murray?

Luke Gardener previews the year ahead for Andy Murray, following his Australian Open final defeat (Thumbnail credit Andy Murray in action at Wimbledon in 2009. Image: E01 via Flickr Creative Commons)

Whole in one - World golf in a nutshell

Sam Morgan discusses the latest goings-on in the world of golf (Thumbnail credit Europe's next Ryder Cup captain. Image: rgusick via Flickr Creative Commons)

Monday Night Lights: Ambrozejczyk on American Sport

David Ambrozejczyk delivers your weekly fix of all things American sport (Thumbnail credit Carmelo Anthony. Image: Keith Allison via Flickr Creative Commons)

DeGale could lead the way in 2011

Boxing expert Graham Lilley returns, this time assessing 2011 for British boxing, in particular focusing on James Degale (Thumbnail credit James DeGale, pictured here with fellow Brit Tony Jeffries. Image: photoverulam via Flickr Creative Commons)

Seventh heaven for Derwent as Vanbrugh brushed aside

A hat-trick from Dan Atherton helped Derwent on their way to a 7-3 hammering of Vanbrugh on Sunday morning (Thumbnail credit Derwent's Dan Atherton shoots for goal against Halifax last week)

Goodricke razor-Sharpe as striker bags five

Goodricke's Jon Sharpe, perhaps the stand-out performer of last term's College Football, carried on his good form with all five of his side's goals as they trounced Alcuin (Thumbnail credit Jon Sharpe shoots for goal last term against Vanbrugh. Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Rawlings brace fails to prevent workmanlike Halifax

Halifax narrowly overcame perennial underdogs Wentworth 3-2, thanks to goals from skipper Tom Ragan, Mark Lund and Conor Brennan (Thumbnail credit Halifax's Dom Petschak, seen here in action against Derwent last week. Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Langwith earn first point with 1-1 draw

A goal from Andy Hutt meant Langwith earned their first points of the term in a 1-1 draw with James (Thumbnail credit Langwith's Cameron Craig, pictured here in action against Goodricke last week. Image: Aaste Haukvik Traen)

Nouse Sport Podcast

By James Bithell

A busy and successful day of BUCS Wednesday is discussed and analysed by the Nouse Sport team, who then go on to debate the merits of replacing York St. John with the University of Hull, air their views on Keys/Gray/Masseygate and have a look at the ins and outs of the January transfer window. Do me a favour love, and listen! (Thumbnail credit Image: Sam Newsome)

Depleted fencers end league season with a whimper

The women's fencers ended their league season with a heavy loss to league-leaders the University of Durham (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

York's netballers too strong for Sheffield

Another win for York was sealed in the netball, where the firsts beat the University of Sheffield seconds 33-20 (Thumbnail credit Image: Aaste Haukvik Traen)

Football firsts two games away from final after fourth round success

The men's football firsts find themselves two games away from the BUCS Cup final after beating Huddersfield firsts 3-2, despite being 1-0 down at the break (Thumbnail credit Image: Sam Newsome)

Rugby seconds humbled by impressive Hull

The men's rugby seconds came up against an unbeaten Hull firsts today and paid the price, losing 52-5 (Thumbnail credit Image: Sam Newsome)

Women's lacrosse defeated by one point

York's women's lacrosse players were on the wrong-end of a close 9-8 scoreline against Leeds firsts today (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Men's badminton reproduce winning formula

The men's badminton team recent good form continued as they dispatched Newcastle University 6-2 to revenge defeat earlier in the season (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

York men squash Northumbria in the cup

With the 4th Round of the FA Cup taking place this weekend, York men's squash team got into the swing of things early with a 3-2 victory over league-leaders Northumbria University (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Derwent take the points against Halifax

A second-half Xander Brinkworth strike allowed Derwent to beat Halifax 1-0 this morning as College Football returned to York (Thumbnail credit Derwent's Dom Henney out-jumps Halifax's Gio Palides. Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Dheir breaks Langwith hearts with winner

A late Nick Dheir goal gave Sam Lewis' Goodricke a 1-0 victory over a resilient Langwith (Thumbnail credit Langwith on a rare foray forward. Image: Aaste Haukvik Traen)

Concerted Alcuin effort defeats James

Alcuin kicked off their term of College Football with a hard-fought 3-2 win over rivals James. (Thumbnail credit James do their utmost to prevent Alcuin. Image: Aaste Haukvik Traen)

Taylor inspirational as Vanbrugh hit Wentworth for five

College Football returned today with Phil Taylor inspiring his Vanbrugh side to a 5-0 victory over Wentworth. (Thumbnail credit Phil Taylor, sporting Vanbrugh's new Crystal Palace-esque kit, attempts to evade the attention of the Wentworth defence. Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

York St. John Sabbatical Officer voices disappointment over Varsity shake-up

York St. John's Vice-President for Student Activities, Jason Chappelow, has voiced his disappointment that Varsity will now be contested between Hull and York and will no longer be between York's intra-city rivals (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Monday Night Lights: Ambrozejczyk on American Sport

Everybody's favourite York-based journalist who focuses on American Sport is back, as David Ambrozejczyk delivers another Monday Night Lights (Thumbnail credit &quot;Karma is a b****&quot; - wise words from LeBron James, a well renowned philosopher. Image: Keith Allison via Flickr Creative Commons)

Netball seconds lose out in Carnegie clash

The netball seconds faced Leeds Metropolitan Carnegie in a top-of-the-table clash yesterday, unfortunately it was the away side who claimed the points winning 37-29 on the day. (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)
